raw_text:
'Comeback' show for Friends star
 
 Friends actress Lisa Kudrow is to play the lead role in a new series about a one-time sitcom star, according to the Hollywood reporter.
 
 Thirteen episodes of Comeback have been commissioned by cable channel HBO, home of hits such as Sex And The City. Kudrow, who played Phoebe in Friends, co-wrote the pilot episode and will also act as executive producer. HBO has been looking for its next big comedy hit since Sex And The City drew to a close in the US in February. Comeback is the first 30-minute comedy series that the channel has picked up since the Sex And The City drew to the end of its six-year-run. Friends ended its 10-year run on the NBC network in May, and attentions have turned to which projects its six individual stars would pursue.
 
 Matt LeBlanc is starring in a Friends spin-off sitcom, charting Joey's fortunes in Los Angeles as he pursues his acting career. Jennifer Aniston, who was Rachel in the long-running show, has enjoyed a series of successful film appearances, with further projects in the pipeline. Courteney Cox Arquette (Monica) has been working on a drama project along with husband David Arquette for HBO, called The Rise And Fall Of Taylor Kennedy. Matthew Perry, who played Chandler, has appeared on the West End stage, and has a film, The Beginning Of Wisdom, currently in production. And David Schwimmer (Ross) directed during his time on Friends, and has also worked on Joey.
llama3.2:1b: Lisa Kudrow will star in a new HBO series called "Comeback" as the lead role of a one-time sitcom star, according to The Hollywood Reporter. She co-wrote the pilot episode and will be executive producer. The show is 13 episodes long and marks HBO's first new comedy series since Sex And The City ended six years ago.
llama3.2:3b: Lisa Kudrow will star in HBO's new comedy series "Comeback", co-writing and producing the pilot episode, after playing Phoebe in the hit sitcom "Friends". The 13-episode show is the channel's first 30-minute comedy series since "Sex And The City" ended.

Kudrow co-wrote the pilot episode and will also serve as executive producer. The show is the first 30-minute comedy from HBO since "Sex And The City" ended its run.

The first 30-minute comedy series that HBO is looking to pick up since Sex And The City ended its six-year run is Comeback, which she's being cast for. Matt LeBlanc is starring in a Friends spin-off sitcom. Jennifer Aniston has a series of successful film appearances, and Arquette's drama project in West End theater is also being considered. Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer have worked on Joey and Ross respectively, but not as co-stars as Kudrow.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Lisa Kudrow will play a one-time sitcom star in Comeback, a new 30-minute comedy series for HBO, following the closure of "Friends."
qwen2.5:3b: Lisa Kudrow, who played Phoebe in Friends, will star in a new HBO series called Comeback about a former sitcom star. Thirteen episodes have been commissioned for the show by HBO, which is looking to replace its hit comedy series like Sex And The City. Kudrow co-wrote the pilot and will serve as an executive producer. HBO has not had a 30-minute comedy since Sex And The City's end. Other Friends stars also have projects: Matt LeBlanc in a spin-off, Jennifer Aniston in films, Courteney Cox Arquette on a drama for HBO, Matthew Perry in film production and David Schwimmer as a director.

Additionally, Matthew Perry, who played Chandler, plays the West End stage, and has a film, The Beginning Of Wisdom, currently in production. David Schwimmer (Ross) has also worked on Joey.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to help summarize this text about the new series coming out from Friends star Lisa Kudrow. Let me read through it carefully.

First, it mentions that the show is a comeback for the original sitcom star, which was on NBC for 10 years now. Then, it says there are thirteen episodes commissioned by HBO because of their success in shows like Sex And The City. They've been working on a comedy series since before Sex And The City ended in February, and this Comeback is the first 30-minute one they've picked up since that show was six years old.

Next, it breaks down each star's project:

- Matt LeBlanc is starring in a spin-off sitcom about Joey's LA life. He has some successful films in progress.
- Jennifer Aniston is back as Rachel, with plans for more work.
- Courteney Cox Arquette and David Arquette are working on a drama called The Rise and Fall of Taylor Kennedy together, with a film in production.
- Matthew Perry appeared on the West End and has a movie called The Beginning Of Wisdom, currently in production.
- David Schwimmer directed on Friends and is involved in another project.

I need to make sure I capture all these key points: Kudrow's new role, thirteen episodes from HBO, the series' purpose as a comeback, each star's projects, and their previous work with friends. Also, I should mention that this is the first 30-minute show since Sex And The City ended in Feb.

I need to make sure it's concise, just key ideas without explanations or formatting. So, structure it to start with Comeback's purpose, then each actor's project, and end with where they're going next.
</think>

Comber is a new 10-minute comedy series set to kick off the future of Friends star Lisa Kudrow as the lead role. It's part of HBO's upcoming spin-offs, starting with Matt LeBlanc playing Joey in Los Angeles. Jennifer Aniston is back as Rachel, and Courteney Cox Arquette and David Arquette are working on The Rise And Fall Of Taylor Kennedy, a drama. Matthew Perry appeared on the West End and has The Beginning Of Wisdom in production, and David Schwimmer directed on Friends, working with Joey. This series is HBO's first 30-minute comedy since Sex And The City ended in February.
tinyllama:1.1b: Lisa Kudrop is set to play the lead role in a new series about a one-time sitcom star, according to Hollywood reporters. The three-season comedy "Comeback" is being commissioned by HBO, which has been looking for its next big comedy hit since "Sex and the City" drew to a close on USA Network in February. Comedy fans have been eagerly awaiting news of the show's production after the "Friends" series came to an end last year. The new series, which will focus on Joey's fortune as he pursues his acting career, will star Matt LeBlanc, who played Joey in the sitcom, along with Jennifer Aniston, Courtney Cox Arquette, and Matthew Perry. HBO has been busy filming projects starring stars of its long-running series, including David Schwimmer (Ross), who directed during his time on "Friends." Additionally, Matthew Perry appeared in the West End stage production "The Beginning of Wisdom" currently in production.

Comeback will follow the lives of a one-time sitcom star as they make their way back into the spotlight after retiring from television. This project marks HBO's first major comedy hit since Sex And The City concluded on the US TV network in February.

granite3.1-dense:2b:
Lisa Kudrow, known for her role as Phoebe in Friends, will star in a new 30-minute HBO series called Comeback, co-written by her and acting as executive producer. The show consists of 13 episodes, marking HBO's first comedy pickup since Sex And The City ended in February. Comeback follows a former sitcom star, reflecting the channel's search for its next major comedy series post-Sex And The City. Friends, which concluded on NBC in May, has sparked discussions about its stars' future projects:

- Matt LeBlanc will lead a Friends spin-off, focusing on Joey's career in Los Angeles.
- Jennifer Aniston, Rachel from Friends, has been busy with film roles and more projects ahead.
- Courteney Cox Arquette (Monica) is working on a drama called The Rise And Fall Of Taylor Kennedy for HBO alongside husband David Arquette.
- Matthew Perry appeared in a West End play and has a film, The Beginning Of Wisdom, in production.
- David Schwimmer (Ross), who directed during Friends, is also working on Joey.
